intro: Oxypetalum echegarayi, commonly known as the Echegaray's oxypetalum, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a smooth texture, while the flowers are predominantly white or pale pink. Oxypetalum echegarayi is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
